title: Cho Gath will be literally unplayable with this change.
body:

They'd better lower his health growth pretty drastically for this buff. Infinite health stacking, with 150 more base health than Sion at level 18? Where 6 ults permanently grants him as much health as Sion killing over 500 minions?

Where he has reliable CC on three of his abilities? Where he can shield for a percentage of said health a few times in a teamfight, effectively giving him a lot more HP? Cmon man, different kits, different balance.

Yes, and now Cho'Gath's kit is different. The difference in base health was fine before, because he could lose his stacks. Now, he can't. Either his base health needs to take a hit, or the amount of health he gets from each stack needs to be lowered.

Before, Cho was rewarded for not dying by being able to reach huge amounts of health (just over 3000 at level 18 with full stacks and no items. But he always ran the risk of losing them. Now, he no longer has that risk. It takes a bit longer to get the full 6 stacks, but it is much more reliable. Plus, he can go beyond 6 stacks now  (with diminishing returns). It should require a few more stacks to get to the same bonus health as before. But, he'll have the potential to get even more health than before, if he plays well.

Plus, with the champions-only mechanic after the 6th stack, it moves the skill expression from "don't die" (run away, avoid fights, or do really well in fights) to "kill lots of champions" (do really well in fights).

I'd say just lower his base health at 18 by 180 - meaning Cho has to have 8 total stacks to reach the same health as before. Which really isn't that tough, just 2 kills.

I really don't think Cho'gath is strong enough to start considering nerfs on him. I agree that Sion's base health sucks, but that really doesn't mean Cho'gath should lose out because of it. Sion gains bonus health passively, Cho'gath actually has to go out and use his ultimate to get it.

This isn't about Sion. I brought up Sion because he's the other health stacking champion in League. Sion's base health is kept low because he can reliably compensate for it - he gains health by killing things and _can't_ lose it. 

Cho had higher base health because - even though he could very easily stack more health than Sion, it was unreliable - if Cho died, he lost stacks. Now, his health stacking _is_ reliable - once he gets the health, he never loses it. 

Even lowering his base health by 180, the changes are still a major buff to Cho. It just means 6 stacks = old 5 stacks, and you never have to worry about losing them. On average, Cho players will essentially _always_ have higher health than before (unless they're bad and can't get kills - or just have a bad game).
